title: Example
text: vignette demonstrates use {samplezoo} package generate datasets varying sizes (small, medium, large) random variables multiple probability distributions. dataset contains: Random variables distributions Normal, Binomial, Poisson, others. Adjustable sample sizes meet needs.

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: {samplezoo} package designed simplify working probability distributions, making easier users teach learn statistical sampling probability models.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version samplezoo GitHub :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Creating reprexing datasets Posit Community help forum, can challenging, especially beginners. Similarly, building quick datasets demonstrate problem lecture assign homework can often involve repetitive code time-consuming easy forget. address challenges save time, {samplezoo} provides streamlined approach. example, generating dataset various probability distributions typically looks like : {samplezoo}, can use one line code:
code: numeric_data <- data.frame(   Variable1 = rnorm(100, mean = 50, sd = 10),   Variable2 = runif(100, min = 0, max = 100),   Variable3 = rpois(100, lambda = 5),   Variable4 = rbeta(100, shape1 = 2, shape2 = 5),   Variable5 = rexp(100, rate = 0.1),   Variable6 = rchisq(100, df = 4),   Variable7 = rbinom(100, size = 10, prob = 0.5),   Variable8 = rt(100, df = 10),   Variable9 = rnorm(100, mean = 100, sd = 20),   Variable10 = rgamma(100, shape = 2, rate = 0.2) )  head(numeric_data) library(samplezoo)  small_data <- samplezoo("small")  head(small_data)

title: Distributions List — distributions
text: list functions generate data frames random variables various distributions. function creates data frame specified distributions sample sizes.

title: Distributions List — distributions
text: list three functions: small Generates data frame 100 samples per distribution. medium Generates data frame 1,000 samples per distribution. large Generates data frame 10,000 samples per distribution.

title: Distributions List — distributions
text: distributions included data frame : norm: Normal distribution mean standard deviation parameters. norm2, norm3: Variations normal distribution different spreads. binom: Binomial distribution. neg: Negative binomial distribution. pois: Poisson distribution. exp: Exponential distribution. unif: Uniform distribution. beta: Beta distribution. gamma: Gamma distribution. chisq: Chi-squared distribution.

what: samplezoo: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case) — samplezoo-package
title: samplezoo: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case) — samplezoo-package
samplezoo: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case) — samplezoo-package
Generate a Sample Dataset — samplezoo
text: Retrieves dataset specified size (small, medium, large) pre-defined distributions list. dataset contains random variables various probability distributions.

title: Generate a Sample Dataset — samplezoo
text: name character string specifying dataset size. Must one : "small", "medium", "large".

title: Generate a Sample Dataset — samplezoo
text: data frame containing simulated data random variables different distributions: norm Normal distribution. norm2, norm3 Variations normal distributions. binom Binomial distribution. neg Negative binomial distribution. pois Poisson distribution. exp Exponential distribution. unif Uniform distribution. beta Beta distribution. gamma Gamma distribution. chisq Chi-squared distribution.

title: Generate a Sample Dataset — samplezoo
text: distributions list defines datasets: "small": 100 samples per distribution. "medium": 1,000 samples per distribution. "large": 10,000 samples per distribution. function verifies dataset name, checks validity, retrieves corresponding dataset distributions.

title: Generate a Sample Dataset — samplezoo
code: # Generate a small dataset small_data <- samplezoo("small")  # Generate a medium dataset medium_data <- samplezoo("medium")  # Generate a large dataset large_data <- samplezoo("large")
